name: (2Z)-2-(1,3-Benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one
Reason: 1,3-Benzodioxole has a melting point of around 100°C. The methylene bridge (–CH2–) adds approximately +10°C due to reducing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The benzodioxole ring itself contributes approximately +20°C due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The thiazole ring introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The pyrimidine ring introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The methylene bridge reduces the symmetry and creates more rigid structure, estimated at around +10°C.
